title: From Bolivia To Indonesia, Deforestation Continues Apace
content: Deforestation continued last year at a rate far beyond pledges to end the practice by 2030, according to a major study.
summary: Deforestation continued last year at a rate far beyond pledges to end the practice by 2030, according to a major study.

title: Israeli Strike Kills 17 At Refugee Camp, Says Gaza Agency
content: Gaza's civil defence agency on Tuesday said an Israeli strike killed at least 17 people at a refugee camp in the centre of the territory, as Israel's military targets Hamas positions
summary: Gaza's civil defence agency on Tuesday said an Israeli strike killed at least 17 people at a refugee camp in the centre of the territory, as Israel's military targets Hamas positions

title: Iran Says Top Commander Survived Israeli Strike On Nasrallah's Likely Heir
content: The top Commander of Iran's Quds Force Esmail Qaani is in 'good health', the force's deputy commander Iraj Masjedi said, after Iranian security sources told Reuters he had been out of contact since strikes on Beirut last week.
summary: The top Commander of Iran's Quds Force Esmail Qaani is in 'good health', the force's deputy commander Iraj Masjedi said, after Iranian security sources told Reuters he had been out of contact since strikes on Beirut last week.

title: Elon Musk Suggests He'll Be Thrown In Prison If Kamala Harris Beats Trump
content: Billionaire Elon Musk suggested on Monday that he would end up in prison if US Vice President Kamala Harris beats Donald Trump in the upcoming presidential election.
summary: Billionaire Elon Musk suggested on Monday that he would end up in prison if US Vice President Kamala Harris beats Donald Trump in the upcoming presidential election.

title: Osama Bin Laden's Son Ordered To Leave France Over Social Media Posts
content: French authorities have ordered Omar bin Laden, a son of slain Al Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden, to leave the country over posts on social media, France's interior minister announced on Tuesday.
summary: French authorities have ordered Omar bin Laden, a son of slain Al Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden, to leave the country over posts on social media, France's interior minister announced on Tuesday.

title: 2 Women Claim They Were Kicked Off Spirit Flight For Wearing Crop Tops
content: Teresa Araujo took to social media to share her side of the story, posting a series of videos recounting the events leading up to her and her friend Tara Kehidi's removal from the Spirit Airlines flight.
summary: Teresa Araujo took to social media to share her side of the story, posting a series of videos recounting the events leading up to her and her friend Tara Kehidi's removal from the Spirit Airlines flight.

title: Madeleine McCann Case Suspect Cleared Of Separate Sex Crimes
content: The German convicted rapist and main suspect in the 2007 disappearance of British toddler Madeleine McCann was on Tuesday cleared of all charges in an unrelated sex crimes trial.
summary: The German convicted rapist and main suspect in the 2007 disappearance of British toddler Madeleine McCann was on Tuesday cleared of all charges in an unrelated sex crimes trial.

title: US Diver Feared Eaten By Shark, But Friend Still Denies Shark Attack
content: An American woman, presumed to have been killed by a shark while diving in Indonesia, possibly died from a medical condition before any encounter with the predator, according to her friend.
summary: An American woman, presumed to have been killed by a shark while diving in Indonesia, possibly died from a medical condition before any encounter with the predator, according to her friend.

title: Nobel Prize In Physics Goes To 2 Scientists For Work On AI
content: Scientists John Hopfield and Geoffrey Hinton won the 2024 Nobel Prize in Physics for discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning within artificial neural networks, the award-giving body said on Tuesday.
summary: Scientists John Hopfield and Geoffrey Hinton won the 2024 Nobel Prize in Physics for discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning within artificial neural networks, the award-giving body said on Tuesday.

title: This Is The Second-Warmest September On Record, Says Climate Watchdog
content: Last month was the second-warmest September ever registered globally in an exceptional year "almost certain" to become the hottest on record, the EU climate monitor Copernicus said on Tuesday.
summary: Last month was the second-warmest September ever registered globally in an exceptional year "almost certain" to become the hottest on record, the EU climate monitor Copernicus said on Tuesday.

title: 5 Russian Mountaineers Killed While Climbing Dhaulagiri In Nepal
content: Five Russian mountaineers were killed while climbing in Nepal, a tourism official said Tuesday, two days after the team lost contact while on the world's seventh-highest mountain, Dhaulagiri.
summary: Five Russian mountaineers were killed while climbing in Nepal, a tourism official said Tuesday, two days after the team lost contact while on the world's seventh-highest mountain, Dhaulagiri.

title: Muhammad Yunus Declares Need for Reforms Before Elections In Bangladesh
content: Bangladesh's interim leader has refused to give a timeframe for elections following the ouster of his autocratic predecessor, saying in an interview published Tuesday that reforms are needed before polls.
summary: Bangladesh's interim leader has refused to give a timeframe for elections following the ouster of his autocratic predecessor, saying in an interview published Tuesday that reforms are needed before polls.

title: Key Suspect Acquitted of Sexual Abuse Charges In Madeleine McCann Case
content: A suspect in the disappearance of British toddler Madeleine McCann was acquitted of unrelated sexual abuse charges by a court in the German city of Brunswick on Tuesday.
summary: A suspect in the disappearance of British toddler Madeleine McCann was acquitted of unrelated sexual abuse charges by a court in the German city of Brunswick on Tuesday.

title: Phantom Cost Explained: Why People Think Freebies Are Too Good To Be True
content: If you're offered a free cookie, you might say yes. But if you're paid to eat a free cookie, would your response be the same?
summary: If you're offered a free cookie, you might say yes. But if you're paid to eat a free cookie, would your response be the same?

title: Elon Musk's Mother Faces Backlash For Suggesting Voter Fraud Before US Polls
content: Maye Musk, the mother of billionaire Elon Musk, has sparked controversy after she appeared to encourage voter fraud a month ahead of the US elections.
summary: Maye Musk, the mother of billionaire Elon Musk, has sparked controversy after she appeared to encourage voter fraud a month ahead of the US elections.

title: Kamala Harris Speaks Up On The Kind Of Gun She Uses. It's A Glock.
content: Democratic presidential candidate Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris revealed in an interview broadcast Monday that she owns a Glock semi-automatic pistol -- and said that "of course" she'd fired it on a shooting range.
summary: Democratic presidential candidate Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris revealed in an interview broadcast Monday that she owns a Glock semi-automatic pistol -- and said that "of course" she'd fired it on a shooting range.

title: Taylor Swift Surpasses Rihanna In Music Rich List, Her Net Worth Is...
content: Pop sensation Taylor Swift is now the world's richest female musician. As of October 8, 2024, Swift has an estimated net worth of $1.6 billion, surpassing another singing superstar Rihanna, Forbes reported.
summary: Pop sensation Taylor Swift is now the world's richest female musician. As of October 8, 2024, Swift has an estimated net worth of $1.6 billion, surpassing another singing superstar Rihanna, Forbes reported.

title: Israel Trades Strikes With Gaza, Lebanon On Anniversary Of War With Hamas
content: A barrage of rockets were fired at Israel from Gaza and Lebanon on Tuesday as its war with Hamas completed a year on October 7.
summary: A barrage of rockets were fired at Israel from Gaza and Lebanon on Tuesday as its war with Hamas completed a year on October 7.

title: Watch: Tourist Attacks Winnie The Pooh Mascot At Disneyland
content: In the footage, a middle-aged man is seen rushing towards the Disney character, Winnie the Pooh, and slapping the performer, who then collapses to the ground.
summary: In the footage, a middle-aged man is seen rushing towards the Disney character, Winnie the Pooh, and slapping the performer, who then collapses to the ground.

title: 2 Men Tricked Apple Into Sending iPhones Worth $2.5 Million. Here's How
content: Two men were sentenced this week for orchestrating a sophisticated scheme, tricking Apple into shipping thousands of iPhones and defrauding the tech giant of $2.5 million.
summary: Two men were sentenced this week for orchestrating a sophisticated scheme, tricking Apple into shipping thousands of iPhones and defrauding the tech giant of $2.5 million.
